title: Paragraph 1
content:
Looking at this image, I can see several key features:

1. There's a formal garden with geometric hedge patterns laid out on a large green lawn
2. The garden appears to be quite large and formal, suggesting it's part of a major park or institutional grounds
3. There are lamp posts/light fixtures visible
4. In the background, I can see urban buildings and what appears to be a cityscape
5. The landscape appears relatively flat with some hills/elevations in the distance
6. The sky is blue with some wispy clouds
7. The vegetation looks well-maintained and formal
8. The hedge patterns create geometric shapes - appears to be boxwood or similar formal hedging

title: Paragraph 2
content: This type of formal garden design with geometric hedge patterns is characteristic of European formal gardens, particularly French or Portuguese styles. The scale and formality suggest this is a major public park or palace grounds.

title: Paragraph 3
content:
Let me think about what cities have famous formal gardens like this:

1. Versailles, France - has famous geometric gardens but this doesn't look quite like Versailles
2. Lisbon, Portugal - Eduardo VII Park has geometric hedge patterns
3. Various other European cities with formal baroque gardens

title: Paragraph 4
content: The background cityscape and the style of the lamp posts could give clues. The buildings in the background look modern mixed with older architecture.

title: Paragraph 5
content: Looking more closely at the hedge pattern and the overall layout, this reminds me strongly of the formal gardens in Eduardo VII Park (Parque Eduardo VII) in Lisbon, Portugal. The geometric boxwood hedge patterns and the view down toward the city are very characteristic of this location.

title: Paragraph 6
content: The lamp posts, the style of the formal garden, the urban backdrop, and the overall layout all seem consistent with Eduardo VII Park in Lisbon. This park is famous for its formal French-style garden with geometric hedge patterns that can be viewed from an elevated position looking down toward the MarquÃªs de Pombal area and downtown Lisbon.

title: Paragraph 7
content: Let me search for more information to confirm this location.Avenidas Novas, Lisbon, Portugal, Europe
